BusinessName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: University of Georgia Research Foundation Inc

IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: THE UNIVERSITY OF GEORGIA RESEARCH FOUNDATION OBTAINS GOVERNMENT AND PRIVATE RESEARCH GRANTS ON BEHALF OF THE UNIVERSITY OF GEORGIA. GRANTS ARE AWARDED TO FACULTY RESEARCHERS AT THE UNIVERSITY OF GEORGIA.
IRS990.MissionDesc: THE UNIVERSITY OF GEORGIA RESEARCH FOUNDATION (RESEARCH FOUNDATION) IS ORGANIZED TO FULFILL BROAD SCIENTIFIC, LITERARY, EDUCATIONAL, AND CHARITABLE PURPOSES AND OPERATES TO ENHANCE THE MISSION OF THE UNIVERSITY OF GEORGIA (UNIVERSITY) OF TEACHING, RESEARCH, AND PUBLIC SERVICE. THE RESEARCH FOUNDATION CONTRIBUTES TO THE RESEARCH FUNCTION OF THE UNIVERSITY BY SECURING RESEARCH CONTRACTS, GRANTS, AND AWARDS FROM INDIVIDUALS, INSTITUTIONS, PRIVATE ORGANIZATIONS, AND GOVERNMENT AGENCIES FOR THE PERFORMANCE OF SPONSORED RESEARCH IN THE VARIOUS UNIVERSITY COLLEGES, SCHOOLS, DEPARTMENTS, AND OTHER UNITS. IN THE INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY ADMINISTRATION AGREEMENT, THE BOARD OF REGENTS OF THE UNIVERSITY SYSTEM OF GEORGIA AUTHORIZED THE RESEARCH FOUNDATION TO SERVE AS THE OFFICIAL RECIPIENT OF ALL RESEARCH CONTRACTS, GRANTS, AND AWARDS FOR THE CONDUCT OF SPONSORED RESEARCH AT THE UNIVERSITY.
IRS990.Desc: THE RESEARCH FOUNDATION CONTRIBUTES TO THE RESEARCH FUNCTION AT THE UNIVERSITY BY SECURING RESEARCH CONTRACTS, GRANTS, AND AWARDS FROM INDIVIDUALS, INSTITUTIONS, PRIVATE ORGANIZATIONS, AND GOVERNMENT AGENCIES FOR PERFORMANCE OF SPONSORED RESEARCH IN THE VARIOUS UNIVERSITY COLLEGES, SCHOOLS, DEPARTMENTS, AND OTHER UNITS.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: THE RESEARCH FOUNDATION DISTRIBUTES A PORTION OF LICENSING AND ROYALTIES REVENUE TO UNIVERSITY DEPARTMENTS AND PROGRAMS AND PROVIDES OTHER DIRECT SUPPORT FOR VARIOUS RESEARCH INITIATIVES AT THE UNIVERSITY.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Schedule D, Part IV, Line 1b Agent, trustee, custodian, or other intermediary arrangement
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE RESEARCH FOUNDATION ACTS AS CUSTODIAN OF FUNDS BELONGING TO AN INTERNATIONAL SCHOLARLY ORGANIZATION WHOSE PRESIDENT IS A UNIVERSITY FACULTY MEMBER. THE FUNDS WILL BE USED AT THE ORGANIZATION'S DISCRETION DURING THEIR TENURE AS PRESIDENT. THE ARRANGEMENT IS DOCUMENTED BY A WRITTEN MEMORANDUM OF UNDERSTANDING.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Schedule F, Part I, Line 3 Method used to account for expenditures on org's financial statements
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: CENTRAL AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN-Accrual; EUROPE (INCLUDING ICELAND AND GREENLAND)-Accrual; SOUTH AMERICA-Accrual

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Schedule I, Part II, Line 1(h) PURPOSE OF GRANT OR ASSISTANCE
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: UNIVERSITY OF GEORGIA: FUNDS ARE PAID TO THE UNIVERSITY FOR EDUCATIONAL AND RESEARCH PURPOSES AND ACADEMIC SUPPORT.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds.
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE UNIVERSITY HAS DESIGNED AND IMPLEMENTED INTERNAL CONTROLS OVER COMPLIANCE WITH GRANT REQUIREMENTS AND IS SUBJECT TO AN ANNUAL AUDIT WHICH TESTS ITS INTERNAL CONTROLS OVER COMPLIANCE FOR FEDERAL GRANT REQUIREMENTS UNDER NEW UNIFORM GUIDANCE (UNIFORM ADMINISTRATIVE REQUIREMENTS, COST PRINCIPLES, AND AUDIT REQUIREMENTS FOR FEDERAL AWARDS), FORMERLY OMB CIRCULAR A-133.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Schedule J, Part I, Line 3 Arrangement used to establish the top management official's compensation
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE PRESIDENT/CHAIR OF THE RESEARCH FOUNDATION IS PAID DIRECTLY BY THE UNIVERSITY FOR HIS ROLE AS PRESIDENT OF THE UNIVERSITY. THE UNIVERSITY SYSTEM OF GEORGIA BOARD OF REGENTS (BOARD) ESTABLISHES THE PRESIDENT'S ANNUAL COMPENSATION THROUGH THE USE OF A WRITTEN EMPLOYMENT CONTRACT, COMPENSATION SURVEY OR STUDY, AND THE APPROVAL BY THE BOARD OR COMPENSATION COMMITTEE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Schedule J, Part I, Line 4b Supplemental nonqualified retirement plan
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE COMPENSATION REPORTED IN PART II, COLUMN C INCLUDES DEFERRED COMPENSATION OF $221,074 PAID BY THE UNIVERSITY DURING 2022 AS PART OF A SUPPLEMENTAL NON-QUALIFIED RETIREMENT PLAN FOR JERE W. MOREHEAD. For fiscal year 2023, the University System of Georgia Board of Regents approved an annualized $225,074 contribution made by the University on behalf of Jere W. Morehead to an approved deferred compensation plan per Board of Regents policy.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Schedule J, Part I SCH J
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE RESEARCH FOUNDATION HAS NO EMPLOYEES. OFFICERS AND SOME DIRECTORS OF THE RESEARCH FOUNDATION ARE EMPLOYED BY THE UNIVERSITY AND ARE COMPENSATED FOR THE ROLE PERFORMED FOR THE UNIVERSITY. OFFICERS OF THE RESEARCH FOUNDATION ARE ALSO OFFICERS OF THE UNIVERSITY WHICH IS THE SUBCONTRACTOR ON ALL SPONSORED RESEARCH RECEIVED BY THE RESEARCH FOUNDATION.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 7a Members or stockholders electing members of governing body
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE RESEARCH FOUNDATION'S PRESIDENT, VICE CHAIR, EXECUTIVE VICE PRESIDENT AND FINANCIAL VICE PRESIDENT (ALL VOTING MEMBERS) ARE ELECTED OR APPOINTED AS EX-OFFICIO MEMBERS BY VIRTUE OF THEIR UNIVERSITY POSITION. THREE VOTING MEMBERS ARE APPOINTED OR ELECTED BY THE UGA ALUMNI ASSOCIATION. THREE VOTING MEMBERS ARE APPOINTED OR ELECTED BY THE UNIVERSITY COUNCIL. THREE VOTING MEMBERS ARE APPOINTED OR ELECTED BY THE UNIVERSITY OF GEORGIA FOUNDATION. FOUR VOTING MEMBERS ARE ELECTED BY VOTE OF THE RESEARCH FOUNDATION BOARD OF DIRECTORS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 11b Review of form 990 by governing body
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: IRS FORM 990 IS PROVIDED ELECTRONICALLY TO BOARD MEMBERS PRIOR TO THE FILING DEADLINE WITH SUFFICIENT LEAD-TIME TO ALLOW FOR REVIEW BY BOARD MEMBERS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 12c Conflict of interest policy
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: BOARD MEMBERS OF THE RESEARCH FOUNDATION ARE GIVEN A FORM TO COMPLETE EACH YEAR REQUESTING DISCLOSURE OF ALL RELATED ENTITIES AND TRANSACTIONS. ANY CONFLICTS NOTED ARE DISCUSSED AND APPROPRIATE ACTION TAKEN, IF DEEMED NECESSARY.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 18 How forms are made available to the public
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE RESEARCH FOUNDATION'S FORM 1023 AND 990 CAN BE REQUESTED THROUGH AN ELECTRONIC REQUEST FORM ON THE RESEARCH FOUNDATION'S WEBSITE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 19 Required documents available to the public
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE RESEARCH FOUNDATION'S GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY, AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC ON THE RESEARCH FOUNDATION'S WEBSITE.
